items.stem: What is the difference between cleaning and disinfection?
options: Cleaning removes dirt; disinfection kills microorganisms.
Cleaning uses heat, disinfection does not.
items.rationale: Cleaning removes debris; disinfection kills remaining bacteria.

items.stem: Which order correctly describes the cleaning cycle?
items.rationale: The proper sequence ensures dirt removal before disinfection.

items.stem: If a disinfectant requires 30 seconds contact time, what should you do?
items.rationale: Allow the disinfectant to stay wet for its required time to kill bacteria.

items.stem: Which of the following prevent cross-contamination?
options: Separate boards for raw and ready foods
Washing hands after handling raw meat
Storing raw meat above cooked food
Using the same cloth for all areas
items.rationale: Keep raw and ready areas separate and wash hands to prevent spread.

items.stem: Where should raw meat be stored in a fridge?
items.rationale: Raw meat goes at the bottom to prevent drips contaminating ready-to-eat food.

items.stem: Why is air drying important after disinfection?
options: It allows disinfectant to continue working and avoids re-contamination.
It prevents corrosion of metal surfaces.
items.rationale: Air drying prevents touching or wiping germs back onto a clean surface.
